Generation I.Red: A brutal Pok é mon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: A brutal Pok é mon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.
Generation I.Yellow: Once it takes aim at its enemy, it blasts out water with even more force than a fire hose.
Generation I.Stadium: It has spouts extending from its shell at the top. They spray water like cannons, hard enough to pierce concrete walls.

Generation II.Gold: It deliberately makes itself heavy so it can withstand the recoil of the water jets it fires.
Generation II.Silver: The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel.
Generation II.Crystal: It firmly plants its feet on the ground before shooting water from the jets on its back.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It deliberately makes itself heavy so it can withstand the recoil of the water jets it fires. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet .
Generation III.Sapphire: Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet .
Generation III.Emerald: The waterspouts that protrude from its shell are highly accurate. Their bullets of water can precisely nail tin cans from a distance of over 160 feet .
Generation III.FireRed: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
Generation III.LeafGreen: The pressurized water jets on this brutal Pok é mon 's shell are used for high- speed tackles.

Generation IV.Diamond: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.
Generation IV.Pearl: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.
Generation IV.Platinum: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It deliberately makes itself heavy so it can withstand the recoil of the water jets it fires.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel.

Generation VI.X: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
Generation VI.Y: The pressurized water jets on this brutal Pokémon's shell are used for high-speed tackles.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet .
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet .

Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: The cannon on its back is as powerful as a tank gun. Its tough legs and back enable it to withstand the recoil from firing the cannon.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: The cannon on its back is as powerful as a tank gun. Its tough legs and back enable it to withstand the recoil from firing the cannon.

Generation VIII.Sword: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
Generation VIII.Shield: The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It deliberately increases its body weight so it can withstand the recoil of the water jets it fires.
Generation IX.Violet: It has jet nozzles on its shell. This impressive Pokémon uses these jets to charge toward foes with all the force of a rocket.
